an5.250:4.1: “Mendicants, there are these five drawbacks of placing faith in an individual.
an5.250:4.3: The individual in whom a person places faith falls into an offence such that the Saṅgha suspends them.
an5.250:4.5: ‘This person I love and like has been suspended by the Saṅgha.’
an5.250:4.6: They lose much of their faith in mendicants.
an5.250:4.7: So they don’t frequent other mendicants,
an5.250:4.8: they don’t hear the true teaching,
an5.250:4.9: and they fall away from the true teaching.
an5.250:4.10: This is the first drawback in placing faith in an individual.
an5.250:5.1: Furthermore, the individual in whom a person places faith falls into an offence such that the Saṅgha makes them sit at the end of the line. …
an5.250:5.8: This is the second drawback in placing faith in an individual.
an5.250:6.1: Furthermore, the individual in whom a person places faith departs for another region … disrobes … passes away.
an5.250:6.3: ‘This person I love and like has passed away.’
an5.250:6.4: So they don’t frequent other mendicants,
an5.250:6.5: they don’t hear the true teaching,
an5.250:6.6: and they fall away from the true teaching.
an5.250:6.7: This is the fifth drawback in placing faith in an individual.
an5.250:6.8: These are the five drawbacks of placing faith in an individual.”
